CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 24, 1954, pg. 1, reads: "Fitt's Cabin Cruiser Burns - The luxurious, 30-foot, powered cabin cruiser, "Ramona," owned by the family of Toussaint Fitts, Courier printer, was destroyed by fire following an explosion as members of the family, including Richard and William S. Fitts, realists, were enjoying a Sunday outing near the Hulton Bridge at Oakmont Sunday night. None of the party was injured.  Fireman [sic] battled the flames for more than an hour.  The family had been riding in boat most of the day on the river. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Stern of fire damaged cabin cruiser boat "Ramona", owned by Fitts family, in shallow water, possibly Allegheny River
